metadata.Title: CVE-2016-3153 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
SPIP 2.x before 2.1.19, 3.0.x before 3.0.22, and 3.1.x before 3.1.1 allowsremote attackers to execute arbitrary PHP code by adding content, relatedto the filtrer_entites function.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3153` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

spip - 3.1.1-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: spip package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.1.1-1').
